data.title: Brookfield Properties Corporation
data.meta_description: News about Brookfield Properties Corporation, including commentary and archival articles published in The New York Times.
data.text:
Affordable Apartments Are Coming to the Top of New York’s Skyline

A deal to build the city’s newest residential skyscraper includes an unusually high number of apartments for low-income renters, plus some set aside for survivors of 9/11.

By Stefanos Chen

Can $50 Million Make a Dull Brooklyn Office Park Cool?

A look inside the rebranding of MetroTech, an outdated corporate campus from the early 1990s.

By Winnie Hu

Suit Settled With Occupy Wall St. Over Seizure of Library at a Park

The City of New York and Brookfield Properties will pay more than $230,000 to settle a lawsuit asserting that books and other property were damaged or destroyed when Zuccotti Park was cleared in 2011.

By Colin Moynihan

City Room

Police Enforcing Unposted Rules at Zuccotti Park, Memo Indicates

The memorandum, labeled “Rules of Engagement,” has added to a long-running argument over Occupy Wall Street’s access to the park, a privately owned public space.

By Colin Moynihan

City Room

At Film Festival, a Sponsorship Leads to a Protest

The Day: Even if Brookfield Properties could have behaved better during the occupation of Zuccotti Park, does it mean that everything it touches is automatically, and irrevocably, tainted?

By Clyde Haberman

ArtsBeat

Tribeca: A Protest Over Festival Sponsor Involved in Clearing Occupy Wall Street

At the Tribeca Film Festival, a small group of filmmakers is protesting the event’s sponsorship by Brookfield Office Properties, owner of the park where Occupy Wall Street took root.

By Stephanie Goodman

Owner Had Right to Clear Zuccotti Park, Judge Says

Judge Matthew A. Sciarrino Jr. of Criminal Court declined to dismiss charges against an Occupy Wall Street protester who was arrested after refusing to leave the park.

By Colin Moynihan

City Room

Lawyer Says Zuccotti Park Demonstrators Broke No Law

A judge hears arguments about how much authority Brookfield Properties has over Zuccotti Park, the site of Occupy Wall Street protests.

By Colin Moynihan

City Room

Civil Liberties Group Joins Occupy Protester’s Fight

At issue is whether the owner of Zuccotti Park had the authority to clear it of demonstrators.

By Colin Moynihan
